root.TEXT:
Record date: 2073-07-04
HPI: 81 y.o.w. with multiple medical problems including DM, HTN, CAD, CHF, PE, depresion here for follow up post EDUCARE-FARGO admission
chart reviewed
since last visit she had 3 admission to the hospital
first due to CHF then to SEH RF and last month again to RSH b/o CHF she was in SNF between those hospitalisations however did not want to go back so now at home
tells me doing well has support a women who cleans cooks shops for her 2 times a week
VN comes once a week
her family is in Kansas
she uses a walker at home came with Patriot chair car
occ still has sob and CP the same
the rash under her L breast bothers her itching
occ legs, ankles,back pain same as before takes tyl;enol was not helpful
now uses ibuprofen 200 mg prn only 1-2 day
BM normal oc constipation , no abdominal discomfort but has bloading
according to record this Sunday her FS 249 - checked by HA
denies depression
has diaper does not c/o dysuria, polyuria
no headache, rash F/C
other ros neg
PMH: Hypertension
Osteoarthritis
Dizziness
amputation : 3rd left toe
Depression : with psychotic features
Lumbar disc disease : s/p discectomy
Cholecystectomy : s/p open procedure
H/O Atrial fibrillation : vs. atrial tachycardia -- s/p cardioversion 2/68
Diabetes mellitus : type 2
Pulmonary embolism : bilateral; tx'd at Buzan County Clinic
Myocardial infarction : NQWMI with inferolateral/apical depressions 5/31/69 - 6/04/69 at Buzan County Clinic; no cath or f/u ETT done there as pt requested conservative management
Pulmonary hypertension : echo 05/70
MMSE 26/29 (could not spell otherwise got everything else) 01/72
SH: lives alone - niece lives down stairs
has Ursula Toth from Gladwin VNA
smoking no
ETOH no
Med: she brings some of her meds reviewed
Hydrocortisone 1% -TOPICAL CREAM TOP BID
Mvi (MULTIVITAMINS) 1 CAPSULE PO QD
Asa (CHILDRENS) (ACETYLSALICYLIC ACID (C... 81MG TABLET take 1 Tablet(s) PO QD
Lasix (FUROSEMIDE) 20 MG (20MG TABLET take 1) PO every Su,Tu,Th
Celexa (CITALOPRAM) 40MG TABLET take 1.5 Tablet(s) PO QD , PA#128310
Vitamin B12 (CYANOCOBALAMIN) 1000MCG TABLET take 1 Tablet(s) PO QD
Synthroid (LEVOTHYROXINE SODIUM) 75 MCG (75MCG TABLET take 1) PO QD x 30 days
Prilosec OTC (OMEPRAZOLE OTC) 20 MG (20MG TABLET DR take 1) PO QD
Ferrous SULFATE 325 MG (325(65)MG TABLET take 1) PO QD
Ipratropium INHALER 2 PUFF INH QID PRN
Tylenol (ACETAMINOPHEN) 500MG TABLET take 2 Tablet(s) PO TID PRN arthritis pain
Ritalin (METHYLPHENIDATE HCL) 5MG TABLET take 1 Tablet(s) PO QD x 30 days
Lopressor (METOPROLOL TARTRATE) 25 MG (25MG TABLET take 1) PO BID
Colace (DOCUSATE SODIUM) 100MG TABLET take 1 Tablet(s) PO TID PRN constip
Ibuprofen 200 MG (200MG TABLET take 1) PO BID PRN
All:Haloperidol Lactate - Unknown
FH:
no hx of CAD, HTN, DM, CVA, no hx of colon, breast, prostate ca
BP 140/80 was 120/80 was 130/80 was 105/70 was 115/70
FS 171
Weight: did not want to go on the scale last weight in chart 168 [Pounds]
General: pleasant, communicative, looks stated age, has hair piece and make up, overweight in NAD
hard of hearing
exam preformed in chair
HEENT: normocephalic and atraumatic, PERRLA, EOMI, no icterus, nose wnl, lips no cyanosis or pallor, dentures
Neck: supple, full ROM, no lymphadenopathy, thyroid gland normal
Lungs: clear to auscultation, no wheezes, rales or ronchi
Heart: normal S1 S2, RRR, no m/r/g
skin under the breast erythema with escoriations
Abdomen: obese BS+, soft, nontender, nondistended
Ext: no clubbing, cyanosis or edema
Mood; appears in good spirits
FS 161
Labs: reviewed
A/P 81 y.o.w.with multiple medical problems including CAD, CHF, djd, DM, htn, depression, anemia, hypothyroid here for follow up
1. cvs seems stableno sign of CHF, BP bordeline but did not take her meds today will check BMP
2. DM will check HbA1c , mircroalbumin not taking any meds for it
3. depression better continue celexa and ritaline
4. hypothyroid TSH normal conitnue same management
5. anemia will check cbc and anemia studies
6. DJD taking only 1-2 ibuproens a day (I tried to get her to take tylenol however she always said it did nto help) also
7. protonix for GI protection and her GERD that seems stable
8. rash fungal ketoconzole prescription given
9 RI check BMP
10. HM check fasting lipid panel
follow up in 4-6 months or earlier prn (pt has weekly visit with VN who monitors her and is in touch with me )
______________________________
Opal Carrie-Guerrero, M.D.
